c74object.name: seq.retrig~

attribute.name: subdiv
attribute.digest: When subdivmode is ‘polymetric’, determines the length of a single step as a subdivision of the input phasor.

attribute.name: repeats
attribute.digest: Number of times the input trigger should occur.

attribute.name: auto
attribute.digest: When disabled (the default), triggers to the first inlet will be retriggered only when the value at the rightmost inlet is nonzero. When enabled all triggers to the first inlet to be retriggered, regardless of the value at the right inlet.

attribute.name: ramplow
attribute.digest: The bottom of the second outlet’s stepped ramp.

attribute.name: ramphi
attribute.digest: The top of the second outlet’s stepped ramp.

attribute.name: rampdir
attribute.digest: Determines whether the stepped ramp from the second outlet goes from low to high or vice versa.

attribute.name: moddepth
attribute.digest: Amount that a list of floats passed into the seventh inlet modulates the subdivision interval.

attribute.name: outputmode
attribute.digest: Determines what is output from the first outlet of the object.

enum.name: trigger
enum.description: The initial input trigger and any subsequent retriggers cause impulses to be output from the first outlet.

enum.name: gate
enum.description: A value of 1 is output over the course of the retrig period. When the retrig period ends, the value flips to 0.

enum.name: count
enum.description: The first outlet produces a running global count of triggers.

attribute.name: transport
attribute.description: This attribute names a master time transport. If internal frequencies are specified using a 'relative' unit (for example: ticks, bars.beats.units, or notevalues), then the named transport is used to determine the frequency based on tempo, time-signature, and other related information. This defaults to the global 'internal' transport, but any named transport can be used.

c74object.description: Create ratcheting patterns and pulses trains with seq.retrig~ A pulse into the first inlet triggers a repeating sequence of pulses. The pulse interval can be modulated using a list.
